CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 1, 1955, pg. 24, reads: "Elks Mortgage Burning - Members of Cora-Steel Elks Lodge, Coraopolis, observed 'Mortgage Burning Week' from Sept. 18 through the 24. Happy expressions on faces of the members reflect their joy at being debt free.  Pictured are Oscar Price, District Deputy Grand Exalted Ruler; Clay Clayborne, press secretary to the Grand Exalted Ruler; A. D. Hayes, district deputy; R. C. Wright, director of public relations; Charles Isenburg, Burgess of Coraopolis; Roy C. Battles, exalted ruler; John Brush, chief of police; Noel Fisher, master of ceremonies; the Rev. E. K. Reves; Mrs. Florence Carter, financial secretary; Mrs. Maudie Wilson, daughter ruler; William Hill, director of economics; William Robinson, past district deputy; Chester White, chairman; William Woodruff; James Carter, trustee; Williams A. Brooks; F. Smith, brigadier general; Hayward Lyles, past state president of West Virginia; George R. Crigler, grand bandmaster; Carl Dickerson, state secretary; Mrs. Lucille Ellet, past vice grand daughter ruler; William Long, inspector, and Mrs. Ollie Battles, co-chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men, posed on platform with banner inscribed "Cora Steel Elks 1064," for Coraopolis Elks lodge mortgage burning ceremony, Coraopolis, another version
